0.user_question: Charlie has boots that are 1865366 times the size of Sophie's. If Sophie wears size 1865366 boots, what is the average size of shoe worn by the two?

direct_answer.text:
To find out the average size, you add both sizes together and divide it by the amount which here is 2 because Charlie has one pair (of twice as large) and Sophie only has one pair. This would look like this: ((size_Sophie)+(size_charlie))/number_pairs=average
So substituting into our variables;((1865366+3*1865366)/2)=avg=(1865366+(3*1865366))/(2)=[(1)*1865366+(3*1)*1865366]/2=[4*1865366]/2=([2]*1865366). Thus, their average boot size if combined equals double [1] or simply [2]. Therefore the numerical value representing the summed averages divided by quantity ([1]+[2])//2 simplifies down to just [2], since all numbers involved share common factor 2..
